resources.string: The historic Amway Grand Plaza is a true destination in the heart of downtown Grand Rapids. It melds history, modernity, restaurants and river views into a single experience.
Refined lodging connected to a convention center, offering a spa, American dining and an indoor pool.
235 Louis St NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49503
Casual suites, some with city views, in a 19th-century property with a rooftop bar and an indoor pool.
161 Ottawa Ave NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49503
Modern lodging with an indoor pool, fitness center and on-site restaurant, plus free WiFi and parking.
10 Pearl St NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49504
Modern hotel offering stylish rooms, plus a hip cocktail lounge and a market-driven bistro.
83 Monroe Center St NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49503
Modest quarters in a riverfront hotel with dining and an indoor pool, plus a free area shuttle.
270 Ann St NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49504
Our coffee house has a Central American theme and an international flair with its culturally diverse environment and philanthropic goals.
208 Grandville Ave SW, Grand Rapids, MI 49503

Are you like the guy in the picture shown with crazy bedhead? Need some coffee to jolt you awake? Enjoy this loftlike coffee shop offering locally roasted beans, snacks and pastries, plus live entertainment.
100 Commerce Ave SW, Grand Rapids, MI 49503

Rising Grinds Café began in 2014 as a coffee training center for young adults as part of the Grand Rapids Center for Community Transformation. There we served a simple food and coffee menu to students and staff of GRCCT, focusing mainly on customer service skills and identifying our niche in the neighborhood.
1167 Madison Ave SE, Grand Rapids, MI 49507
The Sparrows Coffee, Tea, and Newsstand
Cozy cafe in a historic building offering fair trade coffee, tea, locally baked goods and periodicals.
1035 Wealthy St SE, Grand Rapids, MI 49506
Sip Coffee, Save Cats. West Michigans first cat cafe is the purr-fect place to relax. Enjoy a cup of coffee and hang out with adoptable cats!
447 Division Ave S, Grand Rapids, MI 49503
Frederik Meijer Gardens and Sculpture Park is a 158-acre botanical garden and outdoor sculpture park located in Grand Rapids Township, Kent County, Michigan, United States.
1000 E Beltline Ave NE, Grand Rapids, MI 49525

John Ball Zoological Garden is an urban park located on the west side of the city of Grand Rapids, Michigan, United States. The John Ball Zoo is situated on the ravines and bluffs along the west edge of the park. The zoo houses a variety of animals from around the world and is a significant regional attraction.
1300 Fulton St W, Grand Rapids, MI 49504

Millennium Park is the largest urban park in West Michigan, located on the southwest side of Grand Rapids. Millennium Park connects four of the major cities in the area together, including Grand Rapids, Wyoming, Grandville, and Walker.
Museum offers 3 floors of history in an ex-flour mill plus exhibits, a 1928 carousel and planetarium.
272 Pearl St NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49504

The Gerald R. Ford Presidential Museum is the presidential museum and burial site of Gerald Ford, the 38th President of the United States, and his wife Betty Ford. It is located near the Pew Campus of Grand Valley State University in Grand Rapids, Michigan.
303 Pearl St NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49504
Hot Air Balloons are the oldest human-carrying flight technology and RE/MAX is proud to be sharing the beauty of these aircrafts with Grand Rapids residents.
4362 Cascade Rd SE #208, Grand Rapids, MI 49546
LaughFest is a fest that is made for all of us, and that is a good thing. We could all use more laughter.
1806 Bridge St NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49504
Grand Rapids greatest cultural event, featuring live music, homemade food and pastries, cooking lessons, dance demonstrations, and a full bar!
330 Lakeside Dr NE, Grand Rapids, MI 49503
Organic ales and a menu of locally sourced pub grub served in a rustic setting with reclaimed wood.
1 Ionia Ave SW, Grand Rapids, MI 49503
Evocative brewery in a former chapel featuring tours and a pub offering craft beers and French fare.
925 Cherry St SE, Grand Rapids, MI 49506
Overlooking the brewing facilities, this hangout with high ceilings serves craft beer and sandwiches.
235 Grandville Ave SW, Grand Rapids, MI 49503

The Knickerbocker is a taste of many world traditions that have been rediscovered and presented with a fresh perspective. Enjoy a full drink menu including craft beer, artisan spirits, handcrafted cocktails, wine and cider. The Knickerbocker presents a rustic, seasonal menu showcasing local and regional agriculture, old world techniques, with a fresh perspective; including nose to tail butchery, heirloom produce and scratch cooking over fire.
417 Bridge St NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49504
Craft brewery and pizzeria set in a restored Victorian-era firehouse with old-time baseball decor.
527 Leonard St NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49504
